name: indigestibility
content:
indigestibility noun [U]
(FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being difficult or impossible for the stomach to break down: The indigestibility of this starch is responsible for the side-effect of flatulence.
More examplesFewer examplesLower quality forage suffers from indigestibility.A growing foodie movement seeks to rescue the country's cuisine from a reputation for oily indigestibility.Over-frying turned the food at the roadside stand into chunks of concentrated indigestibility.

indigestibility noun [U]
(UNDERSTANDING)
disapproving the fact that information is difficult or impossible to understand: I felt defeated by the indigestibility of the study material. See
indigestible
More examplesFewer examplesHis style clogs the story-telling to the point of indigestibility.The book-readers lament the over-dramatized film and film-viewers lament the indigestibility of the written pages.
